acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.0015mg/L of Crustacea (Northern Brown shrimp) (EHC133, 1992).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value: 1260mg/kg and 2700mg/kg (all are Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), the value of the lower one was adopted and it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Rat LC50 (4 hours) value was >2.210mg/L (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). But Category could not be specificked, it cannot classify since data is insufficient.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on rat LD50 value: 330mg/kg, 415mg/kg, 1700mg/kg, and 660mg/kg (all are Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). Since the calculation values were lower than these lowest values, 330mg/kg was adopted and was set as Category 4.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was classified into Group E according to EPA, it was set as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bioaccumulative (BCF=101.7 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was regarded as outside the categories. Because there are negative results from dominant lethal tests using rats and mice, and there are negative results from the chromosome aberration tests using mammalian bone-marrow cells, which are in vivo mutagenicity tests using somatic cells, and micronucleus tests (both from Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The flash points is 157 degC (ICSC (J) (1996)), and even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: There is no bad effect to the reproductive function, the reproductive potential, and the development of neonatal in the three generation breeding test of rats, and in the administration test during pregnancy using rat and mouse (all are from Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). So it was considered as on the outside of Categry.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classified as out of category because the systemic exposure test using guinea pigs judged that this had no allergic asthma-inducing effect (agrochemical abstract).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since change which suited to acceptance criteria of irritation by the test using a rabbit was not admitted (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was set as the outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since no irritant effect was seen in the test on rabbits (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was classified as out of Category.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classified as out of category because the Landsteiner & Draize method test using guinea pigs judged skin sensitization as negative (agrochemical abstract).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In the six-month feeding oral administration tests using rat and rabbit, and in inhalation exposure test using rat and mouse, since the inhibition of the activity of plasma,  blood cell, and brains cholinesterase was observed by exposure of the guidance value range of Category 1 (all are Agricultural Chemicals abstracts), it was classified into Category 1 (nervous systems).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: By oral, transdermal and inhalation exposures tests using rat and dog, the symptoms which indicates the effects on the nervous systems, and the inhibitions of plasma, blood cells and brain cholinesterase activity were observed in the dosage range of the guidance value of Category 1 (all were Agricultural-Chemical abstracts). So it was classified into Category 1(nervous systems).
